meanings.definition: One who assigns handicaps in sports or games.
meanings.sent1: The handicapper gave the slower runner a head start in the race.
meanings.sent2: The golf handicapper adjusted the scores to make the game fair for all players.
meanings.sent3: The handicapper decided to give the underdog team an advantage to level the playing field.
meanings.sent4: As a handicapper, he carefully calculated the adjustments to ensure a close competition.
meanings.sent5: The role of a handicapper is crucial in maintaining fairness and excitement in sports events.

meanings.definition: A person who predicts the outcome of races or competitions for betting purposes.
meanings.sent1: The handicapper correctly guessed the winner of the horse race.
meanings.sent2: The professional handicapper analyzed the statistics to make informed predictions.
meanings.sent3: The handicapper's lucky guess surprised everyone at the betting event.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a handicapper when she accurately predicted the final score of the game.
meanings.sent5: The handicapper's job involves studying past performances to make educated guesses for betting.
